column5: Well, I reek like pike right now haha, today Rick(Gonefishin), his girlfriend and I all got out bright and early to a new area we haven’t been to,  for what was going to be a great day of Pike fishing. We covered lot's of shoreline and near the end of the stretch we choose we started to pick up fish...then the entire way back. We landed and caught 10 Pike and I frigged up on one of Ricks and lost it then we had another 4 or 5 good hook ups but they ended short.  Fish 1 Spinnerbait    Fish 2 Spinnerbait   Fish 3 Spinnerbait    Fish 4 Spinnerbait    Fish 5 Spinnerbait    Fish number 6 she hooked up and after a quick battle it let go, Rick threw in the same area with the minnow bait and pulled this pike in, a joined catch!    Fish number 7 jerkbait    Fish number 8 spinnerbait    And the last pike, had to do the mercer shot  spinnerbait fish again   can't get rick's 5th pike to load properly but it was equal in size to our average. My advice on this thread is find flats, fish slow and don’t get stuck on color in the murky water conditions. We did lot’s better than last opener and were prepared, having tight drag to get the hook in then a fast half dozen clicks back on the drag was important to let the fish run around and to have some fun tiring them out for easy landing. A amazing day, My guess for the count was 10 today and Rick’s was 12, wish he was right but no way can I complain! Until tomorrow in a different location off shore this time  And the confident smile of the best pike day of out lives   MTBF Thanks for the reading ladies and gents  Edit* Only added 1 pike to this weekends catch, caught a decent little guy on a spoon today. More to come next weekend
Nice going MTBF! Gonna try for some pike around there tomorrow. Thanks for tips and report.
Looks like an awesome day on the water - nice shootting

Looks like you had a great day on the water.  When the pike are on like that it sure is fun.  I love pike fishing.  Gonna beat the shoreline tomorrow hopefully?  Must say, you are pretty brave soles to be out there, the seas look mighty rough
Yup, fishing with the fam jam tomorrow, different place different city lol, was fun fishing different spots. I'll have a report tomorrow, I expect 3-6 fish from our next spot, well see how I do
Yep,wonder why they even took the chance.
Nice ! You did a whole lot better than me.I'm gonna take your advice and go spinnerbait tomorrow.The water is so dirty, i'll have to make some noise and see if that works. Thanks  Paul
Sorry Mike. My sense of humor was out of line.  Regards, Simon
mike, it looks like u had the hot wand today bud. good jawb
nice shooting Mike
It great when all the stars line up for you & you can just Hammer them, nicely done Tight Lines Tomorrow SBK
awesome fish bud.
Good work buddy!

Thanks for the comment's guys, had a great time, there was a pattern to it in the retrieve, I'll let you guys figure it out, really got to feel for things. as for facebook, it's on lockdown unless I really trust you..only have a few OFC guys on there. O well, always will be a bad side to any good thing that happens in this world, only bad side really are the 3 spinnerbaits I went through lol, used the old spinnerbaits to make room for new ones for bass
Good job on the pikers. They were biting good all day
WOW! What a great day! Good for you guys.
nice job it looks like you guys had some fun congratz

Great replies, only managed one small pike at out next spot today  Lot's were sunning their selves on the banks then slid out quickly, 1 more week and a increase of temp and the fish will stay out deeper and be easier to catch!
Nice Pike! I hope I can catch a few that size.
VERY nice day! those are some great looking pike
Solid fun in pike ville Mike-to-the-B-Fish.
Sounds like a perfect spinnerbait day Great job Mike and co Thanks for sharing Leechman
Outstanding day, thanks for posting!
